comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content:
Is that man sitting on a suitcase, having missed the boat?

If you view the largest size, there's some writing on the lifering (is that the proper term), that seems to end in "HAL". So, sould be Youghal. Maybe I'm imagining it.

comment.author: 56105315@N07
comment._content: That is a fabulous image. Looks like grass growing up through the boards, which would suggest that its not used a lot? Wherever it is, I love it.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: That's a very distinctive church steeple, but I don't recognize it.

comment.author: 53227388@N00
30369211@N00
comment._content: Yes, here's a photo of the Sacred Heart church behind that row of seafront buildings in panoramio.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/woesinger] That's excellent! I think I'm not in quite the right spot, because I've got the Mystery of the Disappearing Steeple from this point... Would you mind adding a link to Google Maps??
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 53227388@N00
comment._content: The exact location in the Rushbrook Commercial park/docks in Rushbrooke, Co Cork. g.co/maps/ph5dm I can't seem to post a link from the street view (it truncates to show Rushbrooke), but you have to go a little north along Dock terrace to get a view of the steeple across the water on Street View. Update: Found my Google-fu down the back of the sofa: g.co/maps/sh5pk

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Using the corner of the steeple and the buildings for reference, my best guess for the camera's location is at this green arrow.

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Spot on. The old map shows a "Wooden Jetty" just where your green arrow is. maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,577474,566530,7,9 Click "Street Map (beta)" for the modern view.

comment.author: 24331175@N03
comment._content: is that a doughnut, or a meringue?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Thanks to all of you for the help with the map! Think it's pretty well spot on now, but know at least one of you will be kind enough to let me know if I'm off by a bit...  :)
